title: The Knowledge Exam
text_content:
The knowledge exam is required to obtain your driver's license/permit in Virginia. It consists of two parts and tests your understanding of traffic signs, motor vehicle laws and safe driving techniques.
The exam is multiple choice and can be taken on a computer at DMV
customer service centers
or in
classrooms
at participating high schools. Oral exams are also available by request at all DMV
customer service centers
.
Schedule an Appointment
Find Your Local DMV
Preparing for the Knowledge Exam
Exam questions come from information in the
Virginia Driver's Manual
(
El Manual de Conductor de Virginia
). To study for the exam, be sure to familiarize yourself with the Virginia Driver's Manual and
study guide
(
Guía de Estudio Para Conductores
).
Prohibited Activity
It is unlawful to:
Receive help or assist others while taking the knowledge exam
Possess or attempt to obtain an exam or exam answers
Use a cell phone while taking the exam

Retaking the Knowledge Exam
Regardless of age, if you fail the exam three times, you must complete the classroom portion of a Virginia-approvedDriver Training Schoolprogram and present the Driver Education Certificate at acustomer service center. To be eligible to retake the exam, the course completion date must be after the date of the third exam failure.
